title: Performance issue of inverse of cuda tensor.
body_html:
import torch
import time

t = torch.rand(3,3)
ct = t.cuda()

start = time.time()
for i in range(100):
    t.inverse()

print('cpu: %f' % (time.time() - start))

start = time.time()
for i in range(100):
    ct.inverse()

print('gpu: %f' % (time.time() - start))

On my machine (nVidia GeForce GTX 1080) it produces the following output:

cpu: 0.003675
gpu: 2.056742

PyTorch version : 0.1.12+6f6d70f

body:
```
import torch
import time

t = torch.rand(3,3)
ct = t.cuda()

start = time.time()
for i in range(100):
    t.inverse()

print('cpu: %f' % (time.time() - start))

start = time.time()
for i in range(100):
    ct.inverse()

print('gpu: %f' % (time.time() - start))
```

On my machine (nVidia GeForce GTX 1080) it produces the following output:

```
cpu: 0.003675
gpu: 2.056742
```

PyTorch version : 0.1.12+6f6d70f
